bug.short_desc: Integrate an equivalent to Dialog contribution

long_desc.thetext: There is currently no integrated solution within the framework to easily create a dialog panel as one can do with the Dialog contribution. It would be a great thing to implement an equivalent.
Thanks for the report. But why should we add an equivalent if there is already a solution in the contrib? Is something wrong with that or is it just the fact that it's not in the framework itself?

As you can read it in the mailing-list, the developer of this contribution himself would like to see such an integration. Furthermore, this contribution is a fast developed and dirty implementation (not themable, not L10N support).
So but that would in the end not be an equivalent of the code base, more of the feature set. Now I agree and we should think about adding such dialogs.

(In reply to comment #4) > So but that would in the end not be an equivalent of the code base, more of the > feature set. Now I agree and we should think about adding such dialogs.
Yes, the feature needs be developed from scratch. My code base is basically a fast hack. It works, but is not exactly a model of how qooxdoo code should look like.

Chrome 31+ implements the WHATWG <dialog> element [1][2] and there is also a polyfill [3] available. Currently the feature (see demo page[3]) is hidden behind a flag and no other browser supports it, but this could be the way to go sometime in the future.
[1] http://updates.html5rocks.com/2013/09/dialog-element-Modals-made-easy [2] http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/commands.html#the-dialog-element [3] http://demo.agektmr.com/dialog/
